ah yes, PuTTY -- my favorite Windows app.  :)  Not sure how to do verbose mode on that.  It's a pain in the ass, but you might try getting the Cygwin utilities.  They include a port of OpenSSH, which you call from their port of BASH.
also, if you get the Cyqwom utilities, your Windows box will love you for the rest of your life.  ;)

and you can do cute things, like see your Windows registry from a bash shell ... actually see and delete stuff in the IE cache, and run shell scripts against your own and networked computers.  I drop into bash under cygwin for a huge amount of Windows system administration.
